Set of Natural Numbers

Source: R/Set_Interval_SpecialSet.R
Naturals.Rd

The mathematical set of natural numbers, defined as the counting numbers. i.e. $$\\{0, 1, 2,...\\}$$

See also

Other special sets: Complex, ExtendedReals, Integers, Logicals, NegIntegers, NegRationals, NegReals, PosIntegers, PosNaturals, PosRationals, PosReals, Rationals, Reals, Universal

Super classes

Method new()

Create a new Naturals object.

Usage

Naturals$new(lower = 0)

Arguments

lower

numeric. Where to start the set. Advised to ignore, used by child-classes.

Returns

A new Naturals object.

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

Naturals$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.
